intro: Centaurium bianoris var. roseum, commonly known as the rose-colored lesser centaury, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Gentianaceae and is characterized by its delicate, clustered inflorescences. The plant features slender, upright stems covered in fine hairs and produces small, tubular flowers in shades of pink to rose. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, often with a slightly hairy surface. This variant is prized in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in well-drained, rocky soils.
